reviews.title: easy to transfer.
reviews.review_text: I upgraded from an older radiant max. This one is much faster %26 was easy to transfer most info. Needed to add back a few apps. Very happy with it.

reviews.title: Nice phone, fragile screen.
reviews.review_text: Nice phone but has a very fragile screen. I have had several cell phones over the years and I am prone to dropping them. This is the first one that I have owned that cracked in the bottom right corner. Was not a hard drop and was on padded surface. Overall I give this phone a high rating but disappointed about the screen.

reviews.title: Future Proof for a few years
reviews.review_text: I am having problems connecting threw bluetooth to anything . The reason is this model has Bluetooth v5 . v5 isnt backwards compatible with older chipsets . So while I love this phone , it cant currently connect to most anything I own . It is this planed obsolescence that make me hate Apple products . Not to mention the lack of privacy options and vender locking that also make me hate Apple .

reviews.title: disappointed
reviews.review_text: I bought this phone on January 25th. I bought it because I needed more space and I liked some of the features that it had. From the first day I got it, it just randomly shuts off while you're in the middle of doing something. It shuts off multiple times a day and its usually when i pick it up to reply to a text or something. It gives an error that something stopped responding as soon as it powers up. ive put up with it for almost a month but sadly i think I am going to have to switch back to my old phone. 😭 I love the features of the phone and would probably really be happy with it, IF it was working properly.
Phone wasn't compatible with an important app I needed.

reviews.title: This phone sucks!
reviews.review_text: This photo sucks! I chose this phone because of the 2 year manufacturer warranty. I started having issues very soon after I started using it. Att sent me a replacement but I am still having the same issues with the replacement phone. I actually had to pay for the replacement phone and got a refund when I shipped the original back. This phone shuts off by itself all the time and will come back on when it wants to. When I am talking to someone there will be short periods where the other person can't hear me but I can hear them. I always purchase the cheaper model prepaid phones and they are normally good for the price but not this model. I have had good luck with the Motorola phone and the Samsung as well. I regret this purchase and would never purchase again.

reviews.title: Dead Phone!
reviews.review_text: Phone worked just fine. Plugged in to charge overnight. Woke up to a dead phone. Will not turn on. Will not do anything. Returning to Walmart today. Just bought it Nov.27,.2021. Today is December 6, 2021. Cannot get my info off of phone! Not happy at all! Only gave 1 star because could not give none.

reviews.title: Terrible phone
reviews.review_text: Looked like a good price for the features. So I bought it. It has a good speed and good battery life. But: 1. Fails to make any notifications on messenger. I troubleshoot it many ways, still does not work. 2. Fails to work with Outlook with my work email, works for a few hours, and then needs to be restarted to work again as emails are not coming anymore. 3. Spontaneously failed to receive calls and message notifications from what's up. 4. Quadrupled my contacts with no way to consolidate the copies. I Deleted the copies manually, but in three days extra copies appeared again. Tried to troubleshoot all these issues with no success. Gave it away to a child to use as a toy. Had several LG phones before and had none of these issues.

reviews.title: very unhappy and out quite a bit of money
reviews.review_text: i have had nothing but trouble with my att prepaid account since i put my sims card in this phone. as soon as placed my sims in this phone my account was suspended, when a prepaid account is suspended you lose that phone number because att dont unsuspend prepaid accounts. so i lost my phone number, my bill went from $20 to $125, because I lost ACP benefit, and I lost the $60 prepaid amout i had just paid on my plan. i am very unhappy and will not be staying with ATT or buying another cell at walmart. I sent the phone back and have not received my refund, plus the $22 protection plan they are not refunding me at all.

reviews.title: I am a single senior without phone service.
reviews.review_text: Ordered 1/18, received 1/20. Tried to have activated at AT%26T and Walmart did not release the IMEI number on the phone so it shows that the phone was never paid for so AT%26T locked my account. Customer service created a ticket for resolution and said it would be escalated but would take 24 to 48 hours. This should have been done on the 18th when I ordered the phone. Customer service is nil. As soon as this is resolved, I will no longer support Walmart in any way. As a side note - I wonder how long this process would take if it were not "escalated?

reviews.title: I asked for a phone for security reasons but no he
reviews.review_text: No phone needed to buy another phone since Walmart couldn't. I bought my own phone which didn't work and they said I needed to call att. That sucks. I was in a difficult situation and no one called. I had to buy another phone because Walmart couldn't. They said it didn't work so I had to buy another phone. Bad service.

reviews.title: nothing but issues
reviews.review_text: bought the phone online and had it shipped to the house went through the activation steps and it even let me purchase a plan but then it tells me there's an issue to call 611. i dal 611 and it tells me to go to retailer cause theres a problem activating my device, so i contact walmart and they say theres nothing they can do to call att, been a huge run around since getting the phone. i never would have bought this phone if i knew there would be so many problems

reviews.title: Value for money
reviews.review_text: With the Radiant Max, you get a lot of phone for the price. The display and camera is great although I listen to a lot of audio books and radio using my phone and the audio can be a bit static if turned up. I also found it very difficult to find a protective case for it and had to settle for a hard case rather than a phone wallet which would have been my preference.

reviews.title: liked it but phone calls quit working
reviews.review_text: The phone was very nice and the price was exceptional i loved the phone at first then it quit making and recieving calls so i had to return it. I was afraid to try another one so i bought the Moto One 5 G Ace and everything has been great i did have to pay a bit more but it was worth it.

reviews.title: Piece of junk
reviews.review_text: Do not buy, I bought 2 of these before going on Vacation for 3 weeks. 2 days in both my phone and my wife's phone went beserk. They would open and close multiple apps on its own. This would continue for minutes till we would turn them off. I have done factory reset and safe modes but problem would continue. O Unable to return to Walmart because beyond 14 days before I tried to return them. AT

reviews.title: the worst phone i have ever purchased.
reviews.review_text: This is the worst phone I have ever purchased. At least once a week it will randomly click all over on its own. The only way to get this to stop is to reboot the phone. Also I have never had a phone freeze so much. Finally the ringer is so quiet I can't hear it ring unless I'm right next to it. I replaced this phone with one that cost half the price, and its twice as fast.

I've been calling Walmart selling them about this phone it's no good it's not working right it keep restarting over and over again they said they was going to send me another phone in 2 days that was 2 weeks ago
Product is ok..the service sucked... Waiting two hours without any communication from the store is unforgivable..they had my phone number and knew I was waiting

reviews.title: Total loss
reviews.review_text: Can't update properly, unlocks without the fingerprint scanner, cracks a plenty after just a single drop, this is the worst phone I've purchased from Att, total waste of money, do not purchase

reviews.title: Not worth the hassle!
reviews.review_text: This phone worked fine for about a year. After a year, I started having all kinds of issues. My phone would not unlocked until about 30 seconds after I unlocked it. I would have call issue, where the person on the other end couldn't hear me, but I could hear them. My phone would not immediately make a call, after I pressed call. (all calls, texts, and any other activities would take forever to start. THIS PHONE IS NOT WORTH THE MONEY! If you are looking to purchase a phone for short term use, then this phone may be for you!

reviews.title: Not Activated yet
reviews.review_text: still need to activate it and put the postpaid funds on it so I can use it

reviews.title: Most unreliable
reviews.review_text: I bought the pre-paid 5G Radiant phone from Amazon and my experience is most miserable. The device does what it wants at any given time cuts out of app sessions and only with some good luck it reboots for next never to know how long session.

reviews.title: This is a good phone, but has some problems
reviews.review_text: Would have given this 5 stars if not for the problem i had with the screen. Bought a screen protector for phone, and when i applied it to the phone, found out it already came preinstalled with a screen protector. Trying to install the screen protector ruined both the preinstalled and the new screen protector. Took off both and bought another screen protector, but the screen was already slightly scratched from the previous ones, and came out uneven and with air pockets. Tried again and again with AT%26T to see if they had the original screen protector, they did not. Previous attempts also made screen even more prone to dust, dirt and smudges. My screen with my third screen protector now is somewhat clear only when there is no direct sunlight, otherwise you can't see what's on the screen because of the glare over the smudges. And nothing seems to clean it off. It's a shame because other than this, it's a good phone

reviews.title: breaking now
reviews.review_text: Had this phone for maybe 1 year and has been ok. Most recently it is dropping any call i make or receive and the BT is broke too. There was a recent software update applied so I don't know if the SW update broke it or the hardware is failing. First time I have had something like this happen with a phone.

reviews.title: Terrible phone
reviews.review_text: Looked like a good price for the features. So I bought it. It has a good speed and good battery life. But: 1. Fails to make any notifications on messenger. I troubleshoot it many ways, still does not work. 2. Fails to work with Outlook with my work email, works for a few hours, and then needs to be restarted to work again as emails are not coming anymore. 3. Spontaneously failed to receive calls and message notifications from what's up. 4. Quadrupled my contacts with no way to consolidate the copies. I Deleted the copies manually, but in three days extra copies appeared again. Tried to troubleshoot all these issues with no success. Had several LG phones before and had none of these issues.

reviews.title: I wish I knew
reviews.review_text: I hate this phone. Function seems fine, but I hate that I can't turn off text notifications without silencing everything on the phone. So when people start chatting in a group text my phone is blowing up with hundreds of texts. This makes it very difficult to monitor my phone for important messages because I have to check every message every time they come in. That cuts my work productivity and puts me behind schedule.

reviews.title: Adequate but disappointing
reviews.review_text: I was replacing my Nokia 3.1 due to it having subpar battery life. This phone is frustrating. The battery life is good. Call quality is good. Text messaging sucks. It will go up to an hour before getting notifications from text or other messaging apps. It will freeze with downloading pages. The camera is awesome. It is just a mixture of great and disappointing all at the same time. I have removed unused apps, i flushed cookies and storage, tried resetting items and nothing has changed it. I will be replacing the phone for a better option. This might be a great phone for someone who does limited smart phone things and just wants a phone for voice calls and run a few apps.

reviews.title: Performance very disappointing No Stars
reviews.review_text: Yep great camera and look. However freezes, shuts down, have to reset constantly, very slow retrieving apps, and believe ATT should back up their reputation by re-engineering these phones to fix the bugs and replacing these to all customers. I feel bad because it worked great for about 2 weeks and I bragged about it to everyone until the problems started. The only 2 phones available on Walmart were this one and a Motorola and I swore I would never buy a Motorola again from past issues..... And this phone definitely trumps the Motorola in poor performance. ATT you ripped us off this time.

reviews.title: Solid experience with this phone
reviews.review_text: I purchase my phone a month ago at Walmart. I have been using my new phone for my day to day use as an IT professional and was a little nervous about choosing this phone when I read some of the reviews but decided to give it a try. I use quite a few apps and multiple email clients and have not experienced any of the issues that have been mentioned in the previous reviews. I get texts fast, emails make it to their destination without issue and call clarity is good. I use Windows, Mac and Linux for my duties and test phones using those platforms. I have not experienced any lag whatsoever. My battery is at 97 percent and I unplugged it over an hour ago. I purchased this phone after my Moto G7 stopped receiving security updates. It replaced my LG G8 thinq that got a cracked screen at work. I have iPhones as well so I know a solid phone when I use it. I decided to purchase this phone because it was a good price point for the features that the phone came with and it also came with a 2 year warranty. I have gotten two software updates since I started to use the phone. Updates are important to me since information security is a must these days. I received a text from ATT that spoke of an update to address some issues that were brought to their attention and advised to update the phone but I had already performed the update a week prior.

reviews.title: Solid experience with this phone
reviews.review_text: I have been using my new phone for my day to day use as an IT professional and was a little nervous about choosing this phone when I read some of the reviews but decided to give it a try. I use quite a few apps and multiple email clients and have not experienced any of the issues that have been mentioned in the previous reviews. I get texts fast, emails make it to their destination without issue and call clarity is good. I use Windows, Mac and Linux for my duties and test phones using those platforms. I have not experienced any lag whatsoever. My battery is at 97 percent and I unplugged it over an hour ago. I purchased this phone after my Moto G7 stopped receiving security updates. It replaced my LG G8 thinq that got a cracked screen at work. I haved iPhones as well so I know a solid phone when I use it.

reviews.title: Not Very good Device
reviews.review_text: I've had this Radiant Max for two years so it's been working but a lot of issues. Also you should know that this phone is really a cricket phone and it is off brand so it won't work as well as name brand phone's and there are absolutely no updates done at for this device

reviews.title: Radiant Max: A Solid Prepaid Option
reviews.review_text: I've been using my Radiant Max for a couple days now and I am honestly impressed with this phone. It's not gonna blow any latest generation iPhones or Samsung phones but it's a great option especially considering the price. The only thing I'll comment negatively about this phone in this review is the camera. The camera is definitely not the best quality, but it's not the worst camera out there. Everything else about this phone is solid; the screen, responsiveness, and battery are all pretty good given the price. If you are looking for a good prepaid phone option so you aren't locked to a contract, then I would recommend the Radiant Max 5G.

reviews.title: Just Say NO to Alcatel Phones!
reviews.review_text: Had I done my research better before buying this phone and discovered it was manufactured by Alcatel, I would have never bought it. Had a couple of their phones back in the day when cell phones first came out (yes, I'm that old...lol) and they were garbage then and their garbage now. Pretty typical from what I've come to expect from Alcatel. Phone freezes routinely or lags. I tried calling Customer Service at first and all they could say was "Try turning it off for ten minutes and turning it back on." It usually didn't help. I've had this phone for 6 months now and out of all the past phones I've owned (including past Alcatel phones) this one has been the worse! Apps routinely freeze up causing me to have to stop and restart the phone. I keep the number of apps I have to a minimum thinking this would help, but not so. Spend the money and get a good quality phone like Samsungs. You'll only cry once.

reviews.title: Great phone for the money
reviews.review_text: I this this is a great phone. I upgraded from the old maestro max to this one because it has a bigger screen and one extra gig of ram. Despite some negative reviews I purchased it anyway and I'm happy I did. I have had absolutely no issues with this phone and for the money it's really a great value. It has a large display and is very bright. It's fast and I have no issues playing my games. ( Games like Wonka world and mystery object games)..I have not tried any power demanding games that require higher resources to run them though and with 4 gigs of ram you may be disappointed in doing so. This is definitely not a gaming phone but I have found it quite snappy for everyday casual game playing. The speaker isn't bad either. Overall, I recommend this phone to someone on a budget.

reviews.title: Worst camera ever
reviews.review_text: I got a replacement phone since the first one the camera didn't work. Replacement worst ever. Constantly says app not responding (when I don't even have it open). Shuts down at will, during a phone call, when texting, when using internet etc. Camera works, I think. I have no access to my photos. Really bad experience.
